result.execSummary:
The defendant Jasmine D Haggard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jasmine D Haggard in court, in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Atty Solis was contacted by the clerk's office and indicated that he had not calendared this matter and therefore is not here. Matter was set over to 12/15  Plea hearing scheduled for December 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
from def re: upcoming plea hearing   CC: DA's office, Atty Solis
Plea hearing on December 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jasmine D Haggard in court with attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant Jasmine D Haggard in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense indicates they are not prepared to go forward today and asks for more time. The State just extended a global offer this week; does not object to an adj  Plea hearing scheduled for December 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator) between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defense indicates that deft was in an inpatient rehab facility and then went to an outpatient. Defense indicated that she contacted Mr. Solis when she was released from the hospital. State asks for cash bond and for the former bonds to be forfeited.


BTC: Bond to be set at $10,000.00 cash in each file. Same terms and conditions as previously ordered.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Preliminary hearing on July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
